20  package org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver;
21  
22  import static org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZKSplitLog.Counters.*;
23  
24  import java.io.IOException;
25  import java.io.InterruptedIOException;
26  import java.util.List;
27  import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong;
28  
29  import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
30  import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
31  import org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration;
32  import org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem;
33  import org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path;
34  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.SplitLogManager;
35  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.HLogSplitter;
36  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.CancelableProgressable;
37  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.EnvironmentEdgeManager;
38  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.FSUtils;
39  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZKSplitLog;
40  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZKSplitLog.TaskState;
41  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZKUtil;
42  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperListener;
43  import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZooKeeperWatcher;
44  import org.apache.hadoop.util.StringUtils;
45  import org.apache.zookeeper.AsyncCallback;
46  import org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException;
47  import org.apache.zookeeper.data.Stat;
48  
49  /**
50   * This worker is spawned in every regionserver (should we also spawn one in
51   * the master?). The Worker waits for log splitting tasks to be put up by the
52   * {@link SplitLogManager} running in the master and races with other workers
53   * in other serves to acquire those tasks. The coordination is done via
54   * zookeeper. All the action takes place at /hbase/splitlog znode.
55   * <p>
56   * If a worker has successfully moved the task from state UNASSIGNED to
57   * OWNED then it owns the task. It keeps heart beating the manager by
58   * periodically moving the task from UNASSIGNED to OWNED state. On success it
59   * moves the task to TASK_DONE. On unrecoverable error it moves task state to
60   * ERR. If it cannot continue but wants the master to retry the task then it
61   * moves the task state to RESIGNED.
62   * <p>
63   * The manager can take a task away from a worker by moving the task from
64   * OWNED to UNASSIGNED. In the absence of a global lock there is a
65   * unavoidable race here - a worker might have just finished its task when it
66   * is stripped of its ownership. Here we rely on the idempotency of the log
67   * splitting task for correctness
68   */
69  public class SplitLogWorker extends ZooKeeperListener implements Runnable {
70    private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(SplitLogWorker.class);
71  
72    Thread worker;
73    private final String serverName;
74    private final TaskExecutor splitTaskExecutor;
75  
76    private Object taskReadyLock = new Object();
77    volatile int taskReadySeq = 0;
78    private volatile String currentTask = null;
79    private int currentVersion;
80    private volatile boolean exitWorker;
81    private Object grabTaskLock = new Object();
82    private boolean workerInGrabTask = false;
83    private final int report_period;
84  
85    public SplitLogWorker(ZooKeeperWatcher watcher, Configuration conf,
86        String serverName, TaskExecutor splitTaskExecutor) {
87      super(watcher);
88      this.serverName = serverName;
89      this.splitTaskExecutor = splitTaskExecutor;
90  
91      report_period = conf.getInt("hbase.splitlog.report.period",
92        conf.getInt("hbase.splitlog.manager.timeout",
93          ZKSplitLog.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT) / 3);
94    }
95  
96    public SplitLogWorker(ZooKeeperWatcher watcher, final Configuration conf,
97        final String serverName) {
98      this(watcher, conf, serverName, new TaskExecutor () {
99        @Override
100       public Status exec(String filename, CancelableProgressable p) {
101         Path rootdir;
102         FileSystem fs;
103         try {
104           rootdir = FSUtils.getRootDir(conf);
105           fs = rootdir.getFileSystem(conf);
106         } catch (IOException e) {
107           LOG.warn("could not find root dir or fs", e);
108           return Status.RESIGNED;
109         }
110         // TODO have to correctly figure out when log splitting has been
111         // interrupted or has encountered a transient error and when it has
112         // encountered a bad non-retry-able persistent error.
113         try {          
114           String relativeLogPath = getRelativeLogPath(filename);
115           if (HLogSplitter.splitLogFile(rootdir,
116               fs.getFileStatus(new Path(rootdir, relativeLogPath)), fs, conf, p) == false) {
117             return Status.PREEMPTED;
118           }
119         } catch (InterruptedIOException iioe) {
120           LOG.warn("log splitting of " + filename + " interrupted, resigning",
121               iioe);
122           return Status.RESIGNED;
123         } catch (IOException e) {
124           Throwable cause = e.getCause();
125           if (cause instanceof InterruptedException) {
126             LOG.warn("log splitting of " + filename + " interrupted, resigning",
127                 e);
128             return Status.RESIGNED;
129           }
130           LOG.warn("log splitting of " + filename + " failed, returning error",
131               e);
132           return Status.ERR;
133         }
134         return Status.DONE;
135       }
136 
137       private String getRelativeLogPath(String logPath) {
138         StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
139         String znodeDelimiter = Character.toString(Path.SEPARATOR_CHAR);
140         String[] filenameSplits = logPath.split(znodeDelimiter);
141         int len = filenameSplits.length;
142         String relativeLogPath = logPath;
143         if (len > 3) {
144           // the last three terms are .logs/server/log-file
145           relativeLogPath = sb.append(filenameSplits[len - 3]).append(znodeDelimiter)
146             .append(filenameSplits[len - 2]).append(znodeDelimiter)
147             .append(filenameSplits[len - 1]).toString();
148         }
149         return relativeLogPath;
150       }
151     });
152   }
153 
154   @Override
155   public void run() {
156    try {
157     LOG.info("SplitLogWorker " + this.serverName + " starting");
158     this.watcher.registerListener(this);
159     int res;
160     // wait for master to create the splitLogZnode
161     res = -1;
162     while (res == -1) {
163       try {
164         res = ZKUtil.checkExists(watcher, watcher.splitLogZNode);
165       } catch (KeeperException e) {
166         // ignore
167         LOG.warn("Exception when checking for " + watcher.splitLogZNode +
168             " ... retrying", e);
169       }
170       if (res == -1) {
171         try {
172           LOG.info(watcher.splitLogZNode + " znode does not exist," +
173               " waiting for master to create one");
174           Thread.sleep(1000);
175         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
176           LOG.debug("Interrupted while waiting for " + watcher.splitLogZNode);
177           assert exitWorker == true;
178         }
179       }
180     }
181 
182     taskLoop();
183    } catch (Throwable t) {
184 	   // only a logical error can cause here. Printing it out 
185 	   // to make debugging easier
186 	   LOG.error("unexpected error ", t);
187    } finally {
188 	   LOG.info("SplitLogWorker " + this.serverName + " exiting");
189    }
190   }
191 
192   /**
193    * Wait for tasks to become available at /hbase/splitlog zknode. Grab a task
194    * one at a time. This policy puts an upper-limit on the number of
195    * simultaneous log splitting that could be happening in a cluster.
196    * <p>
197    * Synchronization using {@link #task_ready_signal_seq} ensures that it will
198    * try to grab every task that has been put up
199    */
200   private void taskLoop() {
201     while (true) {
202       int seq_start = taskReadySeq;
203       List<String> paths = getTaskList();
204       if (paths == null) {
205         LOG.warn("Could not get tasks, did someone remove " +
206             this.watcher.splitLogZNode + " ... worker thread exiting.");
207         return;
208       }
209       int offset = (int)(Math.random() * paths.size());
210       for (int i = 0; i < paths.size(); i ++) {
211         int idx = (i + offset) % paths.size();
212         // don't call ZKSplitLog.getNodeName() because that will lead to
213         // double encoding of the path name
214         grabTask(ZKUtil.joinZNode(watcher.splitLogZNode, paths.get(idx)));
215         if (exitWorker == true) {
216           return;
217         }
218       }
219       synchronized (taskReadyLock) {
220         while (seq_start == taskReadySeq) {
221           try {
222             taskReadyLock.wait();
223           } catch (InterruptedException e) {
224             LOG.info("SplitLogWorker interrupted while waiting for task," +
225               " exiting: " + e.toString());
226             assert exitWorker == true;
227             return;
228           }
229         }
230       }
231     }
232   }
233 
234   /**
235    * try to grab a 'lock' on the task zk node to own and execute the task.
236    * <p>
237    * @param path zk node for the task
238    */
239   private void grabTask(String path) {
240     Stat stat = new Stat();
241     long t = -1;
242     byte[] data;
243     synchronized (grabTaskLock) {
244       currentTask = path;
245       workerInGrabTask = true;
246       if (Thread.interrupted()) {
247         return;
248       }
249     }
250     try {
251       try {
252         if ((data = ZKUtil.getDataNoWatch(this.watcher, path, stat)) == null) {
253           tot_wkr_failed_to_grab_task_no_data.incrementAndGet();
254           return;
255         }
256       } catch (KeeperException e) {
257         LOG.warn("Failed to get data for znode " + path, e);
258         tot_wkr_failed_to_grab_task_exception.incrementAndGet();
259         return;
260       }
261       if (TaskState.TASK_UNASSIGNED.equals(data) == false) {
262         tot_wkr_failed_to_grab_task_owned.incrementAndGet();
263         return;
264       }
265 
266       currentVersion = stat.getVersion();
267       if (attemptToOwnTask(true) == false) {
268         tot_wkr_failed_to_grab_task_lost_race.incrementAndGet();
269         return;
270       }
271 
272       if (ZKSplitLog.isRescanNode(watcher, currentTask)) {
273         endTask(TaskState.TASK_DONE, tot_wkr_task_acquired_rescan);
274         return;
275       }
276       LOG.info("worker " + serverName + " acquired task " + path);
277       tot_wkr_task_acquired.incrementAndGet();
278       getDataSetWatchAsync();
279 
280       t = System.currentTimeMillis();
281       TaskExecutor.Status status;
282 
283       status = splitTaskExecutor.exec(ZKSplitLog.getFileName(currentTask),
284           new CancelableProgressable() {
285 
286         private long last_report_at = 0;
287 
288         @Override
289         public boolean progress() {
290           long t = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
291           if ((t - last_report_at) > report_period) {
292             last_report_at = t;
293             if (!attemptToOwnTask(false)) {
294               LOG.warn("Failed to heartbeat the task" + currentTask);
295               return false;
296             }
297           }
298           return true;
299         }
300       });
301 
302       switch (status) {
303         case DONE:
304           endTask(TaskState.TASK_DONE, tot_wkr_task_done);
305           break;
306         case PREEMPTED:
307           tot_wkr_preempt_task.incrementAndGet();
308           LOG.warn("task execution prempted " + path);
309           break;
310         case ERR:
311           if (!exitWorker) {
312             endTask(TaskState.TASK_ERR, tot_wkr_task_err);
313             break;
314           }
315           // if the RS is exiting then there is probably a tons of stuff
316           // that can go wrong. Resign instead of signaling error.
317           //$FALL-THROUGH$
318         case RESIGNED:
319           if (exitWorker) {
320             LOG.info("task execution interrupted because worker is exiting " +
321                 path);
322             endTask(TaskState.TASK_RESIGNED, tot_wkr_task_resigned);
323           } else {
324             tot_wkr_preempt_task.incrementAndGet();
325             LOG.info("task execution interrupted via zk by manager " +
326                 path);
327           }
328           break;
329       }
330     } finally {
331       if (t > 0) {
332         LOG.info("worker " + serverName + " done with task " + path +
333             " in " + (System.currentTimeMillis() - t) + "ms");
334       }
335       synchronized (grabTaskLock) {
336         workerInGrabTask = false;
337         // clear the interrupt from stopTask() otherwise the next task will
338         // suffer
339         Thread.interrupted();
340       }
341     }
342     return;
343   }
344 
345   /**
346    * Try to own the task by transitioning the zk node data from UNASSIGNED to
347    * OWNED.
348    * <p>
349    * This method is also used to periodically heartbeat the task progress by
350    * transitioning the node from OWNED to OWNED.
351    * <p>
352    * @return true if task path is successfully locked
353    */
354   private boolean attemptToOwnTask(boolean isFirstTime) {
355     try {
356       Stat stat = this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().setData(currentTask,
357           TaskState.TASK_OWNED.get(serverName), currentVersion);
358       if (stat == null) {
359         LOG.warn("zk.setData() returned null for path " + currentTask);
360         tot_wkr_task_heartbeat_failed.incrementAndGet();
361         return (false);
362       }
363       currentVersion = stat.getVersion();
364       tot_wkr_task_heartbeat.incrementAndGet();
365       return (true);
366     } catch (KeeperException e) {
367       if (!isFirstTime) {
368         if (e.code().equals(KeeperException.Code.NONODE)) {
369           LOG.warn("NONODE failed to assert ownership for " + currentTask, e);
370         } else if (e.code().equals(KeeperException.Code.BADVERSION)) {
371           LOG.warn("BADVERSION failed to assert ownership for " +
372               currentTask, e);
373         } else {
374           LOG.warn("failed to assert ownership for " + currentTask, e);
375         }
376       }
377     } catch (InterruptedException e1) {
378       LOG.warn("Interrupted while trying to assert ownership of " +
379           currentTask + " " + StringUtils.stringifyException(e1));
380       Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
381     }
382     tot_wkr_task_heartbeat_failed.incrementAndGet();
383     return (false);
384   }
385 
386   /**
387    * endTask() can fail and the only way to recover out of it is for the
388    * {@link SplitLogManager} to timeout the task node.
389    * @param ts
390    * @param ctr
391    */
392   private void endTask(ZKSplitLog.TaskState ts, AtomicLong ctr) {
393     String path = currentTask;
394     currentTask = null;
395     try {
396       if (ZKUtil.setData(this.watcher, path, ts.get(serverName),
397           currentVersion)) {
398         LOG.info("successfully transitioned task " + path +
399             " to final state " + ts);
400         ctr.incrementAndGet();
401         return;
402       }
403       LOG.warn("failed to transistion task " + path + " to end state " + ts +
404           " because of version mismatch ");
405     } catch (KeeperException.BadVersionException bve) {
406       LOG.warn("transisition task " + path + " to " + ts +
407           " failed because of version mismatch", bve);
408     } catch (KeeperException.NoNodeException e) {
409       LOG.fatal("logic error - end task " + path + " " + ts +
410           " failed because task doesn't exist", e);
411     } catch (KeeperException e) {
412       LOG.warn("failed to end task, " + path + " " + ts, e);
413     }
414     tot_wkr_final_transistion_failed.incrementAndGet();
415     return;
416   }
417 
418   void getDataSetWatchAsync() {
419     this.watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().getZooKeeper().
420       getData(currentTask, this.watcher,
421       new GetDataAsyncCallback(), null);
422     tot_wkr_get_data_queued.incrementAndGet();
423   }
424 
425   void getDataSetWatchSuccess(String path, byte[] data) {
426     synchronized (grabTaskLock) {
427       if (workerInGrabTask) {
428         // currentTask can change but that's ok
429         String taskpath = currentTask;
430         if (taskpath != null && taskpath.equals(path)) {
431           // have to compare data. cannot compare version because then there
432           // will be race with attemptToOwnTask()
433           // cannot just check whether the node has been transitioned to
434           // UNASSIGNED because by the time this worker sets the data watch
435           // the node might have made two transitions - from owned by this
436           // worker to unassigned to owned by another worker
437           if (! TaskState.TASK_OWNED.equals(data, serverName) &&
438               ! TaskState.TASK_DONE.equals(data, serverName) &&
439               ! TaskState.TASK_ERR.equals(data, serverName) &&
440               ! TaskState.TASK_RESIGNED.equals(data, serverName)) {
441             LOG.info("task " + taskpath + " preempted from " +
442                 serverName + ", current task state and owner=" +
443                 new String(data));
444             stopTask();
445           }
446         }
447       }
448     }
449   }
450 
451   void getDataSetWatchFailure(String path) {
452     synchronized (grabTaskLock) {
453       if (workerInGrabTask) {
454         // currentTask can change but that's ok
455         String taskpath = currentTask;
456         if (taskpath != null && taskpath.equals(path)) {
457           LOG.info("retrying data watch on " + path);
458           tot_wkr_get_data_retry.incrementAndGet();
459           getDataSetWatchAsync();
460         } else {
461           // no point setting a watch on the task which this worker is not
462           // working upon anymore
463         }
464       }
465     }
466   }
467 
468 
469 
470 
471   @Override
472   public void nodeDataChanged(String path) {
473     // there will be a self generated dataChanged event every time attemptToOwnTask()
474     // heartbeats the task znode by upping its version
475     synchronized (grabTaskLock) {
476       if (workerInGrabTask) {
477         // currentTask can change
478         String taskpath = currentTask;
479         if (taskpath!= null && taskpath.equals(path)) {
480           getDataSetWatchAsync();
481         }
482       }
483     }
484   }
485 
486 
487   private List<String> getTaskList() {
488     List<String> childrenPaths = null;
489     long sleepTime = 1000;
490     // It will be in loop till it gets the list of children or
491     // it will come out if worker thread exited.
492     while (!exitWorker) {
493       try {
494         childrenPaths = ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(this.watcher,
495             this.watcher.splitLogZNode);
496         if (childrenPaths != null) {
497           return childrenPaths;
498         }
499       } catch (KeeperException e) {
500         LOG.warn("Could not get children of znode "
501             + this.watcher.splitLogZNode, e);
502       }
503       try {
504         LOG.debug("Retry listChildren of znode " + this.watcher.splitLogZNode
505             + " after sleep for " + sleepTime + "ms!");
506         Thread.sleep(sleepTime);
507       } catch (InterruptedException e1) {
508         LOG.warn("Interrupted while trying to get task list ...", e1);
509         Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
510       }
511     }
512     return childrenPaths;
513   }
514 
515 
516   @Override
517   public void nodeChildrenChanged(String path) {
518     if(path.equals(watcher.splitLogZNode)) {
519       LOG.debug("tasks arrived or departed");
520       synchronized (taskReadyLock) {
521         taskReadySeq++;
522         taskReadyLock.notify();
523       }
524     }
525   }
526 
527   /**
528    * If the worker is doing a task i.e. splitting a log file then stop the task.
529    * It doesn't exit the worker thread.
530    */
531   void stopTask() {
532     LOG.info("Sending interrupt to stop the worker thread");
533     worker.interrupt(); // TODO interrupt often gets swallowed, do what else?
534   }
535 
536 
537   /**
538    * start the SplitLogWorker thread
539    */
540   public void start() {
541     worker = new Thread(null, this, "SplitLogWorker-" + serverName);
542     exitWorker = false;
543     worker.start();
544     return;
545   }
546 
547   /**
548    * stop the SplitLogWorker thread
549    */
550   public void stop() {
551     exitWorker = true;
552     stopTask();
553   }
554 
555   /**
556    * Asynchronous handler for zk get-data-set-watch on node results.
557    */
558   class GetDataAsyncCallback implements AsyncCallback.DataCallback {
559     private final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(GetDataAsyncCallback.class);
560 
561     @Override
562     public void processResult(int rc, String path, Object ctx, byte[] data,
563         Stat stat) {
564       tot_wkr_get_data_result.incrementAndGet();
565       if (rc != 0) {
566         LOG.warn("getdata rc = " + KeeperException.Code.get(rc) + " " + path);
567         getDataSetWatchFailure(path);
568         return;
569       }
570       data = watcher.getRecoverableZooKeeper().removeMetaData(data);
571       getDataSetWatchSuccess(path, data);
572       return;
573     }
574   }
575 
576   /**
577    * Objects implementing this interface actually do the task that has been
578    * acquired by a {@link SplitLogWorker}. Since there isn't a water-tight
579    * guarantee that two workers will not be executing the same task therefore it
580    * is better to have workers prepare the task and then have the
581    * {@link SplitLogManager} commit the work in SplitLogManager.TaskFinisher
582    */
583   static public interface TaskExecutor {
584     static public enum Status {
585       DONE(),
586       ERR(),
587       RESIGNED(),
588       PREEMPTED();
589     }
590     public Status exec(String name, CancelableProgressable p);
591   }
592 }
This page was automatically generated by Maven
